publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2526 Pauline McNeill: Breastfeeding Clinic at Yorkhill, Glasgowâ€”That the Parliament congratulates the Queen Mother's Hospital at Yorkhill NHS Trust in establishing Scotland's first breastfeeding clinic where breastfeeding mothers can attend every Monday between 8.00 am and 6.00 pm without an appointment; notes that this is the first open clinic of its kind in Scotland, and supports the encouragement which the clinic will offer to mothers to continue breastfeeding beyond the initial two weeks in order to benefit both their health and that of the baby.

S1M-2526 Pauline McNeill: Breastfeeding Clinic at Yorkhill, Glasgow-That the Parliament congratulates the Queen Mother's Hospital at Yorkhill NHS Trust in establishing Scotland's first breastfeeding clinic where breastfeeding mothers can attend every Monday between 8.00 am and 6.00 pm without an appointment; notes that this is the first open clinic of its kind in Scotland, and supports the encouragement which the clinic will offer to mothers to continue breastfeeding beyond the initial two weeks in order to benefit both their health and that of the baby. Supported by: Donald Gorrie*
S1M-2526 Breastfeeding Clinic at Yorkhill, Glasgow (lodged on 6 December 2001) Tommy Sheridan*, Trish Godman*, Christine Grahame*
